%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. One of two versions of Sphere M12 used by Duty. This one is more commonly used and improves upon original M12 in terms of physical and psy protection, at cost of slightly increased weight and worse resistance to elements. It is supposed to be worn with PSZ-9d armored suit, same as original M12 is worn with the Bulat.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. Of two versions of Duty's Sphere M12, this one is more technologically advanced, and therefore both more protective and lighter. Same as the PSZ-9d "Red Line", this tactical headset is only given to most well-known soldiers of Duty, who achieved great things for their faction. This helmet is not only a masterpiece of combat design, but also a sign of great honor and high position within Duty's ranks. \n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. PSM-4 is a heavy and bulky, but very durable combat helmet. It has an integrated, tough gas mask reinforced with a number of metal parts and fit for popular EO-19 filters. It also has a class IIIA anti-ballistic visor. The helmet is very heavy due to its mostly metal construction and very slight use of modern synthetic materials. It is very uncomfortable, but thanks to its thickness it is not only very physically resistant, but also capable of shielding the wearer from a considerable amount of external psy influence. It should be noted, that this thickness, compared with mostly meatl build, make the inside of helmet heat up really quickly, possibly posing a threat to the wearer. It is therefore highly adviced to take the helmet off when in close proximity of thermal anomalies. Even though the PSM-4 cannot be count among more optimal helmets, it is still used by some Duty soldiers who require solid protection, but lack the money to afford high-end gear. There also are some old military equipment enthusiasts, who wear the PSM-4 just for its characteristic, vintage look. \n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. Even further modernized version of EO-20 PBF gas mask, designed by Stalker craftsmen. It is both more protective and resistant, and it uses filters that are slightly lighter and guarantee a bit better protection from irradiated particles and toxins. Its visor is wider and more impact-resistant; the apparatus was also made less susceptible to any sources of physical damage.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. EO-21 PBFM gas mask modified by Duty for enhanced physical protection. It is at the point of highest, most optimal and budget-friendly defence/weight ratio. This is the Krasnyy series model, designed for use with the modified PS5-2M; regular verison of this mask used by Duty is simply an original EO-21 with red filters.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. The most compact, lightest gas mask in the Zone. It is commonly known as the "sawn-off EO-21", as it looks like if someone took the original mask and cut off its upper half. In thruth, this mask was designed this way and is meant for use in less contaminated areas. Its main goal, aside of protection of course, is to make using it as comfortable as possible. It can be used both by itself or with an oxygen tank, which can be attached by a pipe to a socket present on the left side of the mask, just above one of its filters. It uses the exact same filter type as full sized EO-21.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] REMOVED FROM GAME. Compact version of EO-21 gas mask used by low-ranking Duty members in the least contaminated areas of the Zone. Compared to its original version, the mask was made just slightly more resistant, optimizing it for combat performance to minimize the risk of any heavy damage. Even though it still doesn't stand much of a chance against pistol bullets, it won't crack after recieving a strong punch, and will save the wearer's teeth as well.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1] DUPLICATE. REMOVED FROM GAME. Originally manufactured from 1962 to 1989, the GP-5 gas mask was built with the intention to protect the Soviet people from radioactive fallout. It is a helmet-mask made of white and black rubber, with the lenses held in place by a crimping rim. The filters, however, have been restored or replaced with a great deal of care. Compared to gas mask kits of similar price and availablity, such as the PBF, this reconditioned respiratory device boasts greater protection against radiation, but an even greater failure rate in toxic environments.\n \n

%c[ui_gray_1]NOT IN GAME. A higher quality version of the regular Sunrise bodysuit, made of more resistant and expensive materials. The main build of the suit is pretty much the same as that of basic Sunrise, but the use of higher quality materials lead to increased protective qualities without a significant increase in weight. The suit is also more durable and has a potential for more advanced modifications. The "Vineleaf" version is mainly focused of increasing the wearer's mobility and comfort without reducing its protective qualities. It achieves this goal by the use of a more flexible, thermoactive fabric; the outfit slightly shrinks when exposed to a high heat. Stalkers who just bought the outfit make their way to the nearest thermal anomaly and stand next to it for a while - the outfit then shrinks and fits their body perfectly as a result. Even though it sounds dangeorus, nobody ever reported the suit disturbing their blood flow. This fabric also seems to be a bit more difficult to cut, therefore making the suit grant more protection from attacks of weaker mutants. One last quality of this suit is that its inner layer is treated with a compound which slighlty cools the body, increasing comfort. As its name suggests, "Vineleaf" bears a camouflage in colors similar to that of a vine or ivy leaves. The pattern comprises of large, irregularly shaped spots of lighter and darker shades of the color.\n \n
